wikipedia_page.main:
Frederick Augustus Hervey, 4th Earl of Bristol,  (1 August 1730 – 8 July 1803), was an 18th-century Anglican prelate.
Elected Bishop of Cloyne in 1767 and translated to the see of Derry in 1768, Hervey served as Lord Bishop of Derry until his death in 1803.
He his remembered for designing mansions at Downhill and Ballyscullion and he was known as the Edifying Bishop or The Earl-Bishop (in allusion to prince-bishop).
